awd_titl_txt: Testing Complex Systems with Reusable Tests
awd_abstract_narration: Hayes         This research deals with obtaining a fundamental  understanding of how to use hierarchy effectively in testing (as  it is used in design).  The three integrated components of the  research are:  1.     how to design and control propagation of precomputed test  stimuli to each module of the circuit from the circuit inputs and  propagation of responses from the module to the  circuit outputs;  2.     development of test-preserving transformations of circuits  which allow a circuit design to be changed during synthesis while  preserving the fault coverage powers of a known or transformed  test set; and  3.     finding methods for designing built-in-self-testing circuits  to provide localized input stimuli generation and response  analysis for modules.         Theorems and algorithms are being developed.
